docs.title: Project Overview
docs.text:
• Colearn aims to provide a platform where users can find projects based on their skill sets and interests, and collaborate effectively with others.
  • This platform targets developers, researchers, volunteers, and creative professionals looking to join collaborative projects.
  • This platform allow users to create projects and build teams around shared goals.
  • The platform should facilitate seamless flow from project discovery to collaboration, ensuring users can join project teams once they are accepted.
  • The project include features for communication, project management and resource sharing among team members.

docs.title: In Current Phase
docs.text:
• Authentication: A secure login/signup system and role based access control.
  • Project Creation: Users can create projects by providing necessary details such as title, description, required skills, and location tags.
  • Project Discovery: Users can search for projects based on filters like skills, title, and location tags, and view detailed project information.
  • Project Joining: Users can apply to join projects, and project owners can review applications and accept or reject applicants.

docs.title: In Future Phase
docs.text:
• Team Communication: A chat feature for real-time communication among team members.
  • Task Management: Project owners can create and assign tasks, set deadlines, and track progress.
  • Progress Tracking: Periodic progress updates based on task completion data.
  • Dedicated Resource Sharing: A section for team members to share documents and resources within the project team.
  • Mentor Support: Project owners can select mentors from a dedicated section to provide guidance to project teams.
  • Freelancer Integration: Integration with freelancer platforms to allow users to find paid opportunities within projects.

docs.title: Colearn is a versatile platform that can be applied across various domains and industries. Here are some common use cases:
docs.text:
• Open Source Collaboration: Developers can find open source projects that match their skills and interests and collaborate with other developers worldwide.
  • Academic Research: Researchers and students can find research projects, join teams, and collaborate on experiments, data analysis, and paper writing.
  • Non-Profit Initiatives: Volunteers can find non-profit projects that align with their passions, apply to join teams, and contribute to social causes.
  • Corporate Team Projects: Employees can use the platform to manage internal projects, collaborate with colleagues, and share resources effectively.
  • Creative Collaborations: Artists, designers, and content creators can find collaborative projects, share ideas, and work together on creative endeavors.
  • Freelancing support: Freelancers can find projects that require their expertise, apply to join teams, and collaborate with clients and other freelancers and earn monetary rewards.
  • Mentorship: Experienced professionals can mentor project teams, providing guidance and support to help them succeed and earn monetary rewards.

docs.title: Requirements
docs.text: In this section, we outline the key functional requirements, non-functional requirements, and out-of-scope features for the Colearn platform.

docs.title: F1: Authentication
docs.text:
• Users should be able to sign up using their email address, password or Google account.
  • All the users who sign up using google account were assigned a default password, which they can change later.
  • All the users who sign up using email and password should verify their email address via a otp sent to their email.
  • Users should be able to reset their password via a "Forgot Password" feature that sends a password reset link to their registered email.
  • JWT token based authentication and authorization will be implemented for secure access to the platform.

docs.title: F2: Project Creation
docs.text:
• Users should be able to create new projects by providing necessary details such as project title, description, required skills, and location tags.
  • Project owners should be able to edit project details after creation.

docs.title: F3: Project Discovery
docs.text:
• Users should be able to search for projects based on filters like skills, title, and location tags.
  • Users should be able to view detailed information about each project, including project description, requirements, and team members.

docs.title: F4: Project Joining
docs.text:
• Users should be able to apply for projects they are interested in with a note explaining their interest and relevant skills.
  • Project owners should be able to view a list of applicants for their projects, along with their application notes.
  • Project owners should be able to accept or reject applicants. Accepted users should receive a email notification and be able to access the project dashboard.

docs.title: F5: Project Dashboard
docs.text:
• A dedicated project dashboard should be available for each project, accessible only to project team members.
  • The dashboard should provide role based access to all project-related features, including communication, task management, progress tracking, and resource sharing.

docs.title: F6: Team Communication
docs.text: • Team members should be able to send and receive messages in real-time using a chat feature on a common forum.

docs.title: F7: Task Management
docs.text:
• Project owners should be able to create tasks, assign them to team members, and set deadlines.
  • Team members should receive reminders through email for upcoming deadlines and be able to mark tasks as complete.

docs.title: F8: Progress Tracking
docs.text:
• System should generate periodic progress based on task creation and completion data.
  • Progress updates should be viewable by all team members on the project dashboard.

docs.title: F9: Resource Sharing
docs.text: • Team members should be able to upload and share documents, links, and other resources within the project team on a dedicated resource sharing section.

docs.title: Features not included in the current project phase
docs.text:
• Team Communication Feature.
  • Task Management Feature.
  • Weekly Progress Tracking.
  • Dedicated Team Resource Sharing.

docs.title: Login/Signup using google account.
docs.text:
• Actor: User
  • Precondition: User is on the login/signup page.
  • Postcondition: User is logged in and redirected to the dashboard.
  • Main Flow:
    1. User clicks on "Login with Google" button.
    2. System redirects to Google OAuth page.
    3. User enters Google credentials and grants permissions.
    4. System verifies credentials and logs in the user.
    5. If the user is new, a new account is created in the system and an email with a default password is sent to the user's registered email.

docs.title: Signup with Email/Password
docs.text:
• Actor: User
  • Precondition: User is on the login/signup page.
  • Postcondition: User is logged in and redirected to the dashboard.
  • Main Flow:
    1. User selects “Sign up with Email”.
    2. Fills form with name, email, and password.
    3. System validates inputs and checks existing email.
    4. If new email, system generates 6-digit OTP.
    5. OTP sent to user’s email.
    6. User enters OTP for verification.
    7. On success, account created and verified.
    8. User is logged in and redirected to dashboard.

docs.title: Create a project.
docs.text:
• Actor: Registered User
  • Precondition: User is logged in and on the project creation page.
  • Postcondition: New project is created and visible on the platform.
  • Main Flow:
    1. User navigates to "Create Project" page.
    2. User fills in project details (title, description, required skills, location tags).
    3. User submits the project creation form.
    4. System saves the project and confirms creation.

docs.title: Search for projects.
docs.text:
• Actor: Registered User
  • Precondition: User is logged in and on the project discovery page.
  • Postcondition: User views a list of projects matching the search criteria.
  • Main Flow:
    1. User navigates to "Discover Projects" page.
    2. User enters search criteria (skills, title, location tags).
    3. User submits the search form.
    4. System retrieves and displays a list of matching projects.

docs.title: Apply to join a project.
docs.text:
• Actor: Registered User
  • Precondition: User is logged in and viewing a project detail page.
  • Postcondition: User's application is submitted for review by the project owner.
  • Main Flow:
    1. User navigates to a specific project detail page.
    2. User clicks on "Apply to Join" button.
    3. User fills in application note explaining interest and relevant skills.
    4. User submits the application.
    5. System notifies the project owner of the new application.

docs.title: Review applicants and accept/reject them.
docs.text:
• Actor: Project Owner
  • Precondition: Project owner is logged in and viewing their project's applicant list.
  • Postcondition: Applicant is accepted or rejected, and notified accordingly.
  • Main Flow:
    1. Project owner navigates to their project's applicant list.
    2. Project owner reviews each applicant's details and application note.
    3. Project owner clicks "Accept" or "Reject" for each applicant.
    4. System updates applicant status and sends email notification to the applicant.

docs.title: Test Plan
docs.text:
This document outlines the test plan for the Colearn project, detailing the acceptance criteria for major modules.

Module Description User Authentication Signup, Login, Protected Routes Project CRUD Create, Read, Update, Delete Project Joining & Approval Apply, Approve, Reject

docs.title: 1.1 Signup
docs.text:
• User must be able to sign up using Google OAuth or email/password.

  • User must be able to create an account with:

    • Valid email
    • Password meeting required length
    • OTP verification

  • System must validate missing or invalid fields.

  • Duplicate email registration must be rejected.
  • Password must be hashed securely in the database.

  • Successful signup must return:

    • 201 status
    • User data (excluding password)
    • Auth token

docs.title: 1.2 Login
docs.text:
• User must be able to log in using:

    • Valid email
    • Correct password
    • Wrong password: 401 Unauthorized
    • Non-existing email: 404 User Not Found

  • On successful login:

    • JWT token must be returned
    • User details must be returned
    • Token must allow accessing protected routes

docs.title: 1.3 Protected Routes
docs.text:
• Access without token: 401 Unauthorized
  • Access with invalid or expired token: 403 Forbidden
  • Access with valid token must succeed

  • Authentication module passes if:

    • Valid users can sign up and log in
    • Invalid credentials are rejected
    • JWT protects secure routes
    • Passwords are never exposed

docs.title: 2. CRUD Operations on Project — Acceptance Criteria
2.1 Create Project
docs.text:
• Only authenticated users can create projects.

  • Required fields:

    • title
    • description
    • required skills
    • location
    • Missing fields: 400 Bad Request

  • Successful creation must return:

    • 201 status
    • Full project object

docs.title: 2.2 Read (Get Projects)
docs.text:
• Any user can view project listings.

  • Must support filtering by:

    • Skill
    • Title
    • Location

docs.title: 2.3 Read (Get Single Project)
docs.text:
• Must return full project details.
  • Invalid project ID: 404 Not Found
  • Only project members can access project dashboard details such as chat, resources.

docs.title: 2.4 Update Project
docs.text:
• Only the project owner can update a project.
  • Unauthorized update: 403 Forbidden
  • Successful update returns the updated project object.

docs.title: 2.5 Delete Project
docs.text:
• Only the owner can delete a project.

  • Deleting must also remove:

    • Pending applications
    • Member relations

  • Successful delete: 204 status

docs.title: Project CRUD passes if:
docs.text:
• Owners can manage their projects
  • Non-owners cannot modify or delete
  • Filters and search work correctly
  • Validation errors are meaningful

docs.title: 3. Project Joining and Approval Workflow — Acceptance Criteria
3.1 Apply to Project
docs.text:
• Only authenticated users can apply.
  • User cannot apply to their own project.
  • User cannot apply more than once.

  • Successful application must:

    • Store application status as "approved"
    • Notify the user of successful application.

docs.title: 3.2 View Applications (Owner Only)
docs.text:
• Only project owners can see the list of applicants.
  • Unauthorized access: 403 Forbidden

docs.title: 3.3 Approve Application
docs.text:
• Only owner can accept a pending application.

  • After approval:

    • User becomes a project member
    • Status updates to "accepted"
    • Apply button must show Accepted

docs.title: 3.4 Reject Application
docs.text:
• Only the owner can reject an application.
  • Status must update to "rejected"
  • Applicant must receive notification of rejection.

docs.title: 3.5 Member Cannot Reapply
docs.text:
• Accepted users cannot reapply.
  • Rejected users cannot reapply unless explicitly allowed.

docs.title: Join and Approval workflow passes if:
docs.text:
• Users can apply only once
  • Owners can accept or reject applications
  • RBAC ensures correct permissions
  • Application statuses update correctly
  • UI reflects correct state transitions
